Issues.Title: WindowsDesktop SDK should recognize Application.xaml
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.100-preview4-011006
* Windows version: 17763.437
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: N/A, this is a tooling issue

 **Problem description:**

The Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop SDK only recognizes `App.xaml` for an automatic ApplicationDefinition item. The Visual Basic project templates call this file `Application.xaml`. Unless the file is renamed or an ApplicationDefinition item is manually specified, the project won't compile.
 
 **Actual behavior:**

The SDK should recognize both App.xaml and Application.xaml.
 
 **Expected behavior:**

Only App.xaml is recognized.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WindowsDesktop SDK should recognize Application.xaml" (#550)

Issues.Title: Recognize Application.xaml as well as App.xaml
Issues.Body: VB projects, by convention, use Application.xaml for the name of their ApplicationDefinition file. Without this change, we run into the problem described at https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/500. Fixes #550.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Recognize Application.xaml as well as App.xaml" (#545)

Issues.Title: LOC CHECKIN | Add PresentationBuildTasks xlf localization
Issues.Body:
* Add initial xlf files for PresentationBuildTasks

* Bring PresentationBuildTasks translations over from NETFX

* Modify PresentationBuildTasks csproj to enable satellite assembly generation

* Don't exclude PresentationBuildTasks from xlf localization in ShippingProjects.props

Issues.Title: Add helper script and update developer guide
Issues.Body: This PR adds a helper script that I've been using locally that helps me test my local changes. It also updates the developer-guide.md on how to use the script effectively, as well as some other helpful information about testing locally built assemblies. I'm not sure how to test PBT yet, and hopefully @ryalanms can share more information on how that can be done.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Add helper script and update developer guide" (#543)

Issues.Title: Inconsistent line endings on fresh clone
Issues.Body:
Hi,

On a fresh clone of the repo, I see this when opening many files:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1427284/55759397-38855f80-5a27-11e9-94af-c4f4a1d6dc06.png)

This particular one is `MarkupCompilePass2.cs`, but it happens on others as well. This could lead to problems with bad PR's and merges down the road.

Can the line endings be normalized in the repo and the right `.gitattributes` be added?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Inconsistent line endings on fresh clone" (#533)

Issues.Title: Column span fails for Pixel columns into Auto columns (under certain conditions)
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.0-preview3-27503-5
* Windows version: (`10.0.17134`)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
 
 **Problem description:**
A Grid column set to Pixel width that is then spanned into an Auto width column to its right gets a bad final size, and in practice ignores the size set on it. If an Auto column is spanned into, it should "absorb" the required space, i.e. it should measure the content, subtract what the fixed size says its size is, and the remainder should be the width of the Auto column.
 
 **Actual behavior:** 
The Pixel width column is unaffected by size (if the size is smaller than the measured size of the child), and ignores its ColumnSpan.
 
 **Expected behavior:**
The Pixel width column should span into the Auto column to its right, with the aggregate width for the two columns equaling the desired size for the content, such that the Pixel size gets precisely that width and the Auto column absorbing the rest.
 
 **Minimal repro:**
```
    <Grid>
        <Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
            <ColumnDefinition Width="*" />
            <ColumnDefinition Width="5" />
            <ColumnDefinition Width="Auto" />
        </Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
        <Grid.RowDefinitions>
            <RowDefinition Height="Auto" />
            <RowDefinition Height="*" />
        </Grid.RowDefinitions>

        <Label Grid.Row="0" Grid.Column="1" Grid.ColumnSpan="2" Content="SomeText"/>
        <Label Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="2" Content="T" />
    </Grid>
```

Notice how you can set the width of column with index = 1 to any number smaller than the measured size of its child ("SomeText") and nothing happens. It is not spanning into the Auto column to the right, nor does it care what the size is. This seems very wrong to me. A Pixel column + an Auto column should, taken together, be capable of accommodating a child that is spanning across them, and the Auto column should absorb the remaining space.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Column span fails for Pixel columns into Auto columns (under certain conditions)" (#528)

Issues.Title: Why is WPF PathFigure not filled at certain rotations?
Issues.Body:
The arrow is supposed to have a red fill but the fill is missing at certain angles of the RotateTransform. It vanishes from ~92° to ~279°

_This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/519747/why-is-wpf-pathfigure-not-filled-at-certain-rotati.html
VSTS ticketId: 841039_
_These are the original issue comments:_
(no comments)
_These are the original issue solutions:_
(no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Why is WPF PathFigure not filled at certain rotations?" (#524)
